message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000
1. Create a new basic project
2. Create a new file 'test.xml'
3. The editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content
4. Select 'test.xml' in Navigator
5. Choose 'Open With'... / 'Default Text Editor'

After selecting 'Default Text Editor', nothing happens; it reactivates the scripted resource editor example

Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types

Expected Behavior: It should open a new editor on the file because the editor type is different

NOTES: ", "EB": "", "SR": "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000
1. Create a new basic project
2. Create a new file 'test.xml'
3. The editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content
4. Select 'test.xml' in Navigator
5. Choose 'Open With'... / 'Default Text Editor'

After selecting 'Default Text Editor', nothing happens; it reactivates the scripted resource editor example

Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types

Expected Result: It should open a new editor on the file because the editor type is different

NOTES: "}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'EB': '', 'SR': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: "}
